body_html: @ebrevdo This seems to be another error related to nested higher order function, although this time I was running a scan with bidirectional_rnn embedded in the step function. Previous reports on segmentation fault happening on OSX platform seemed to focus on the erroneous link of cuda library. In my case, I only used the CPU.
body_text: @ebrevdo This seems to be another error related to nested higher order function, although this time I was running a scan with bidirectional_rnn embedded in the step function. Previous reports on segmentation fault happening on OSX platform seemed to focus on the erroneous link of cuda library. In my case, I only used the CPU.
body: @ebrevdo This seems to be another error related to nested higher order function, although this time I was running a `scan` with `bidirectional_rnn` embedded in the `step` function. Previous reports on `segmentation fault` happening on OSX platform seemed to focus on the erroneous link of cuda library. In my case, I only used the CPU.
